entries.author: glen_hinkle
entries.text: Mango is no go anymore, announces Glen Hinkle, as the project has been deprecated.
entries.title: Mojo News: Mango

entries.author: gabor_szabo
entries.text: It's  time to say farewell... Gabor Szabo lets us know that the Perl community adserver is going down.
entries.title: Shutting down the Perl Community AdServer

entries.author: moritz_lenz
entries.text: The Perl 6 community needs a new server. Moritz Lenz tells you how you can pitch in.
entries.title: A new Perl 6 community server - call for funding

entries.author: neil_bowers
entries.text: At the London Perl Workshop, Neil Bowers happily reports, Mark Keating was awarded a  Silver Camel for his excellent work within the Perl community. Well-deserved and, oh my, that's one heck of a spiffy trophy.
entries.title: The Silver Camel goes to ... Mark Keating

entries.author: david_farrell
entries.text: David Farrell gives us the new modules that made their apparition in October.
entries.title: What's new on CPAN - October 2014

entries.text: Instead of working 'according to the book' and writing all the acceptance tests first, Gabor started to build the actually web application by setting up the PSGI skeleton.
entries.title: Create skeleton PSGI application for the SCO project

entries.text: Embedding HTML in the Perl code is a no-go. All the HTML needs to be in separate template files.
entries.title: Start using Template Toolkit to show the empty pages

chapters.header: The Perl Maven Pro subscribers receive two new articles and screencasts every week. The last week these were the two screencasts:
chapters.title: Perl Maven Pro

entries.author: toby_inkster
entries.text: Toby Inkster quickly jolts down his favorite talks of the event.
entries.title: Quick post-LPW roundup

entries.author: neil_bowers
entries.text: Neil Bowers gives us an overview of the talks he attended this year at the LPW.
entries.title: The London Perl Workshop 2014

entries.author: paul_evans
entries.text: Paul Evans shows a few way one can imbed the result of a function call within a string.
entries.title: Printing function calls in Perl

entries.author: yanick_champoux
entries.text: Yanick updated his semantic version plugin for Dist::Zilla to accommodate all and any of the common versioning schemes CPAN modules use.
entries.title: Semantic Versioning Your Way

entries.author: yanick_champoux
entries.text: Yanick Champoux was left alone for a whole week-end. This never ends well...
entries.title: Fumbling Toward CatalystX::Info
CPAN Great Modules Released Last Week

entries.text: A collection of MetaCPAN related articles and screencasts. The audience starts from plain users, through CPAN module authors, all the way till MetaCPAN developers.
entries.title: Meta::CPAN

entries.text: The second part of the 'Introduction to Perl 5 Regexes' series.
entries.title: Regex character classes

header: This weekend was rocking Perl on both sides of the Atlantic. On the New World side: The Pittsburgh Perl Workshop. Meanwhile in the Old World: the London Perl Workshop. No doubt helped by a 6 hours headstart, echoes and reports already began to trickle about the latter event. Amongst other things: Mark Keating was awarded the Silver Camel (congrats!). Of the PPW nary a word yet, but you can bet that will change by next week. Till then, enjoy! `/anick
subject: And the Silver Camel Goes To...
